title: Blasieholmen Church
text:
Blasieholmen Church

Blasieholmen Church (Swedish: Blasieholmskyrkan) was a Lutheran church at Blasieholmen in Stockholm built in 1867 and inaugurated with a church service on 12 January 1868. It was demolished in 1964. It was built on initiative from the priest Gustaf Emanuel Beskow.
summary: Blasieholmen Church was a Lutheran church at Blasieholmen in Stockholm built in 1867 and inaugurated with a church service on 12 January 1868. It was demolished in 1964. It was built on initiative from the priest Gustaf Emanuel Beskow.
